intro: Ingenhoussia spinosa, commonly known as the African firecracker, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub characterized by its spiny stems and small, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for birds and small mammals. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is cultivated in some regions for horticultural purposes.
